result.title: Yard optimization algorithm, network decision-support tool and integration framework
result.description: Description of the optimization algorithms and simulation integrated environment: description of the yard optimization algorithm designed (from 5.2); description of the decision-support tool for the link to the network of the yard optimized management (from 5.3); description of the simulation-optimization integration (from 5.1-5.2-5.4); description of the yard-network integration (from 5.1-5.2-5.3-5.4).

result.title: Business Case Feasibility and Simulation Test of the virtual yard/terminal software
result.description: This deliverable will summarise the feasibility tests of the virtual yard/terminal software and optimisation modules carried out by the two business cases in Czech Republic and Italy. It will contain all comparative results (AS-IS solution versus ‘step-by-step optimisation’ and ‘integrated system’) and all the envisaged scenarios.

result.title: Definition of a suitable simulation environment
result.description: This deliverable will set out findings from Task 3.1 to order to specify the requirements for a generally applicable simulation environment. It will develop an understanding of both the physical characteristics of marshalling yards and the data required for their management, and then assess the development needs for the VILLON simulation environment to be addressed in subsequent WPs.

result.title: Import competition and firm productivity
result.description: Understanding how firms can integrate into GVCs and what can they benefit from them. We use two approaches and datasets to investigate this question by conducting qualitative surveys, linked to financial data to measure ownership, ICT intensity and international activities in a number of countries; Using these data to investigate the factors usually identified as engine of productivity at the firm-level (size, organisation, technological capacity, access to credit), but also at the institutional macro-level (e.g. labour market regulations, education/skills availability, product market access).
